content: the space indicated  repeat repeat - repeat the instructions starting at the asterisk *  prev previous  yo yarn over  skip st skip next stitch  blo single_crochet only in back loop of stitch  r1 round/row 1 - shorthand way to indicate a specific round or row  fo fasten_off cut yarn tail pull up the loop on the hook and pass your yarn tail through pull tight to close weave in ends  same st - the st found at the base of the beginning chain 1  chain 2 counts as st  this beanie is worked from the top down stitches used  st stitch - shorthand for stitch  single_crochet single_crochet - insert hook into stitch yo & pull up a loop pull through 2 remaining loops  double_crochet double_crochet - yo insert hook into stitch yo & pull up a loop yo pull through 2 loops on hook yo pull through remaining loops  half_double_crochet half-double_crochet - yo insert hook into stitch yo & pull up a loop yo pull through all 3 loops on hook  slip_stitch slip_stitch - insert hook yo pull up loop and through 1st loop on hook page 2 copyright© 2016 debra brannon of trinity z trinketz you may use this pattern for personal use gifts & charity sales of finished product are permitted but designer requests that you link back to pattern and credit trinity z trinketz w/ the original design under the creative commons attribution-share alike license no part of this document may be reproduced or transmitted in any form by any means electronic mechanical photo-copying or otherwise without prior written permission from the author pattern instructions r1 begin with a slip knot and an elastic band position the slip knot on the inside of the band and then slip_stitch to attach the yarn to the band ch1 then work 24 single_crochet around the band slip_stitch to first single_crochet to join if you left a long enough beginning tail you can save yourself some weaving-in time by hiding it under your stiches as you single_crochet around the band 24 sts ***if you choose to march to your own drum and not use an elastic chain 24 and slip_stitch into the first chain to form a ring chain 1 and single_crochet 24 sts into the ring slip_stitch to first single_crochet to join 24 sts *** page 3 copyright© 2016 debra brannon of trinity z trinketz you may use this pattern for personal use gifts & charity sales of finished product are permitted but designer requests that you link back to pattern and credit trinity z trinketz w/ the original design under the creative commons attribution-share alike license no part of this document may be reproduced or transmitted in any form by any means electronic mechanical photo-copying or otherwise without prior written permission from the author r2 chain 2 double_crochet in next st and in each single_crochet from prev row when you reach your first single_crochet
